result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathon Lloyd Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$5000-$10,000 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Maintain full time work or school or a combination of both.  Any other conditions per agent.

records.addlTxt: filed by Court Reporter Chris Champeau, hearing held March 14, 2016
Restitution Stipulation in the probation amount of $5510.12 plus surcharge for a total of $6061.13.
Filed by ADA Christine M. Genda
Filed by Atty Leonie Dolch
Filed by Atty Leonie Dolch
Filed by Atty Leonie Dolch

Defendant Jonathon Lloyd Smith in court, in custody with attorney Leonie Dolch.  Christine Marie Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.  Information filed, reading waived.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant pled no contest to Ct. 1.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Ct. 2 dismissed but read in.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 4 years in prison.  1 year initial confinement and 3 years extended supervision, consecutive to Lacross County case 15CF141.  Conditions of extended supervision include: $518.00 costs.  Restitutution in the amount of $6061.13.  Maintain full time work or school or a combination of both.  Any other conditions per agent.  Defendant is eligible for the challenge incarceration program and substance abuse program.  No credit.
with Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus to New Lisbon for March 14, 2016

Attorney Leonie Dolch appeared. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant will need a writ.  New date requested.  State had no objection.  Return date scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
Atty. Dolch requests Jan. 5, 2016 be reset, unable to speak with defendant yet as he is in prison. - fax
